Question 133) Refrigerator manuals have the recommendation that the equipment should not be installed near heat sources such as stove and heaters, or in a place where sunlight directly on. Installation in an inappropriate place impairs the operation of the refrigerator and increases the power consumption.
Non -compliance with this recommendation results in increased energy consumption because
A) The condenser driving heat flushes is considerable reduction.
B) The temperature of the soda substance in the condenser decreases faster.
C) Heat plower promotes significant temperature rise inside the refrigerator.
D) Liquefaction of the condensing soda substance requires more work from the compressor.NO
E) Convection currents near the condenser occur with greater difficulty.
